solution_line_template: Since the ratio of boys to girls is {boys_ratio_part}:{girls_ratio_part}, then the class is divided into {boys_ratio_part} + {girls_ratio_part} = <<{boys_ratio_part}+{girls_ratio_part}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts} parts.
The girls have {girls_ratio_part} - {boys_ratio_part} = <<{girls_ratio_part}-{boys_ratio_part}={difference_in_parts}>>{difference_in_parts} parts more than the boys.
Since {difference_in_parts} parts are equal to {more_girls_students}, then 1 part is equal to {more_girls_students}/{difference_in_parts} = {students_per_part} students.
Hence, there are {total_ratio_parts} parts x {students_per_part} = <<{total_ratio_parts}*{students_per_part}={total_students}>>{total_students} students.
